1.title: Andasibe-Mantadia National Park
1.description: Located about 140 km east of Antananarivo, Andasibe-Mantadia is one of Madagascar’s most famous national parks. It includes Mantadia Park and the Analamazaotra Special Reserve.
1.fauna: home to the largest lemur, the Indri-Indri.
1.flora: humid tropical rainforests rich in orchids and ferns.
1.activities: hiking, nocturnal wildlife watching, village visits.

2.title: Isalo National Park
2.description: Located in southwestern Madagascar, Isalo is famous for its dramatic canyons, rocky plateaus, natural pools, and sandstone formations shaped by wind and time.
2.flora: Landscapes: canyons, caves, cliffs, and natural pools.
2.activities: hiking, swimming in natural pools, exploring rock formations.
2.access: near Ranohira, reachable from Toliara or Fianarantsoa.

3.title: Ranomafana National Park
3.description: Nestled in the eastern highlands, Ranomafana is a biodiversity jewel with dense rainforest, hot springs, and many endemic species.
3.fauna: Wildlife: 12 species of lemurs, rare frogs, chameleons, birds.
3.flora: Flora: humid rainforest with tree ferns, orchids, giant bamboos.
3.activities: ecotourism, night walks, hot spring bathing.

4.title: Tsingy de Bemaraha National Park
4.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site in western Madagascar, famous for its dramatic karst formations known as 'tsingy' – unique stone forests.
4.fauna: Wildlife: lemurs, bats, rare reptiles, endemic birds.
4.flora: Formations: sharp limestone peaks, hanging bridges, caves.
4.activities: climbing, via ferrata, cave exploration, tsingy hiking.
4.access: challenging, usually via Morondava and Bekopaka (road and pirogue).
4.bestTime: June to November (closed in rainy season).

galleries.title: To discover:
galleries.description: Discover the most iconic animal and plant species of Madagascar. Between endemic fauna and spectacular flora, dive into a unique ecosystem shaped by millions of years of isolated evolution.

items.title: Lemur
items.desc: Endemic primates of Madagascar, iconic symbols of the island, known for their social behavior and expressive big eyes.

items.title: Fossa
items.desc: Madagascar’s top predator, the fossa is an agile carnivore, feline-like, hunting both on the ground and in trees.

items.title: Malagasy Kingfisher
items.desc: A small forest bird with vibrant orange hues, endemic to Madagascar, often seen in humid eastern forests.

items.title: Panther Chameleon
items.desc: A tree-dwelling reptile with vivid, changing colors, one of the most colorful of its species, living mainly in eastern and northern forests.

items.title: Ravinala
items.desc: National symbol of Madagascar, the Ravinala is recognizable by its fan-shaped leaves and its ability to store water.

items.title: Baobab
items.desc: Majestic and sacred tree, endemic to Madagascar, famous for its massive trunk.
